title: Electric flux - square of area A in field E

content.question: A square of area <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math> is in a region of space with a uniform electric field of magnitude <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi></math>, as shown in the figure. The field makes an angle of <math alttext="30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn></math> degrees with the plane of the square. If the flux through the square from the field is <math alttext="phi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi></math>, what is the magnitude of the electric field?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, the fraction 2 over the square root of 3, close parenthesis, times, the fraction phi over A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi>A</mi></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the square root of 3, end root, times the fraction phi over A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi>A</mi></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="2 times the fraction phi over A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi>A</mi></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 times the fraction phi over A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi>A</mi></mfrac></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
